PIONEER DIET: WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

Instructions: Please answer as many of these questions as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask., where it will be preserved as part of the permanent record of our Province.

Name Robert Young
Address 107-10th Ave. S.W.
Birthplace Prince Albert, Ont.

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1892
Where did you set up housekeeping? Prince Albert, Sask.
Where had you been living before that? Weyburn, Sask.
For how many people did you prepare meals? 5
How far was it to your nearest store? 1 mile
How often could a visit be made to the store?
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? Flour, oatmeal, tea, bacon, eggs, lard, butter, fruit such as prunes, dried apricots, dried apples, syrup

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Great Western
In what quantities did you buy it? 50 lbs.
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $4.00
How much did you use graham flour?
Whole wheat flour?
Was flour milled locally? Yes
How far away? 25 miles
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? $1.50
What other grain products did you use? Cornmeal
Other?
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? No
How did you grind it?

20. Mention any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the earliest days as compared with today.

Well in early years you had to make a meal out of whatever you had on hand now you can run to the grocer and pick up a meal of canned stuff.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of homegrown and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible).

As I started to homestead in 1902 I had to rely on purchased foods.

22. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying groceries and securing foods in other ways during pioneer days in Western Canada. Include items not mentioned above, quality, methods of merchandising, prices, problems of storage, shortages and other details. (Use back of page if more space is needed).

As I was a bachelor most of the early years I am sticking to those years therefore didn't have much dealing as to church or sometimes of the school.
20. Mention any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the earliest days as compared with today.

With early years you had to make a meal out of whatever you had on hand. Now you can turn to the grocer and pick up a meal of canned goods.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of housegrown and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible.)

As I started to homestead in 1902, I had to rely on purchased foods.

22. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying groceries and securing foods in other ways during pioneer days in Western Kansas. Include items not mentioned above, quality, methods of purchasing, problems of storage, shortages and other details. (Use back of page if more space is needed.)

As I was a bachelor most of the early years I am sticking to those years. Therefore, I didn't have much dealing with the school as to lunch sometimes.
